intro: Metrosideros rugosa, commonly known as the rough bark pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal areas, characterized by its rough, flaky bark and bright red or orange flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds dispersed by birds. It is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and strong winds. Its flowers bloom in late summer and early autumn, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects.
